ratings.comment: Her lectures are very clear and have a good variety of proofs and worked examples. I also really recommend going to her office hours, I didn't start going until halfway through the semester and they really helped. Math 320 was easy overall but Professor Wen made it even easier with her great teaching.

Unlike other courses, there is an emphasis on proofs. Dr. Wen gave a great introduction to the subject. She prepares meticulously for every class and puts a lot of effort into her teaching. Also, she had an instant answer for any question. In short, a very smart and knowledgeable professor. Do yourself a favor and take the course with her!

I can tell that she prepares a lot for this class. She gave students worksheets in class, notes on Canvas every week. Difficulty of assignments is also acceptable, with 70% easy proofs and 30% hard proofs but can find hints in the textbook. But if you have a good mathematical foundation, her class may be a little easy and boring.

Dr. Wen is the best professor I've ever had. She is so incredibly thoughtful with her teaching. She is so prepared for lectures and could not be more clear with concepts. She really cares about feedback from her students and you know exactly what to study and what you have to know to get an A in this class.

This professor is off the charts well organized, and so is the course. Grading criteria, homeworks, practice midterms, opportunities to provide feedback, everything is clear and impeccably organized. All you need to do is read .. a lot! The course is difficult of course, being proof based, but everyone knows that!

Boya is one of the few professors in the math department who feels like she wants to help students learn. She's very accessible and helpful during office hours. Her lectures were very theoretical though. She did some examples but a heavy portion of it dealt with theorems and definitions that did not apply to the assignments.
She was one of the best professor I have ever had. Her lectures were very clear and I would definitely recommend taking her for Math 340.

If you are unsure which professor to choose and if she is on the list, CHOOSE her! She provides appropriate amount of examples for illustrating concepts and uploads all resources for studying purposes. She is also quite accessible and friendly, both in and out of class. A fairly easy course and even possible to do 100%, though I did not.

The class is generally easy if you don't miss classes and study past exams. Professor Wen is incredibly devoted to instructing her classes. She replies in Piazza in a fast manner and her office hours are a great time to ask about anything directly or tangentially related to the material. her pacing was just perfect IMO.

Boya is amazinggggg. Compared to a horrible experience in calc 2, linear algebra was a breeze. She shares so many resources and wants everyone to do well. Professor Wen is great at answering questions, records all lectures, and uploads pdfs of her notes, other professors' notes, and hw/worksheet solutions. 10/10

One of the best math professors at UW-Madison. She's very by-the-book, so definitions can get a little confusing, but for such complex & in-depth material, she does an amazing job at providing us with ample examples & explanations. She's also very open to feedback about her teaching because she wants the class to be well-suited for the students.

I have now had Boya for 2 different classes, and both times she was a great professor. Boya was easily reachable by Piazza, email, or office hours. You can tell that she cares about her students and wants to see them succeed. It is by no means an easy class, but she does everything she can to make the content as straightforward as possible.

Highly suggest taking her class!

She uploads all lecture recordings AND notes for indefinite access. Despite being a hard class, she made it easy to understand and used tons of examples. Biggest regret is not using her office hours more.

Class graded on 3 midterms (last one is a final), 8/10 best hw assignments, 4 pts hw extra credit available!

Professor Wen has the heaviest workload among all my courses. The text is difficult and many problems to solve in limited time. The lectures are uploaded on canvas but still hard to understand. The final exam has pretty much problems and it's really hard to get an A or AB.

Professor Wen had amazing lectures, very clear and concise. I would also highly recommend attending office hours, especially with questions on the homework. Exams were very straightforward. The textbook was helpful but lectures covered all necessary material.

Boya gives you the BEST lectures and one of the heaviest workloads (comparing to all my other courses). Prepare to learn A LOT and also struggle. You'll miss the world if you don't come to class. Working hard pays off.
On top of everything: GO TO HER OFFICE HOUR!!! She's super nice and she will try every possible way to help you learn and grow!

She has amazing lecture notes, which are logical, clear, and sufficient comparing to most math courses in UW-Madison. Her office hour also helps for exams, and she provides many practice problems to support what you learn. Although her grading is a little bit tough, she still worth a big recommendation. (541 destroys my GPA lol)

Professor Wen was definitely considered one of the best teachers for 320. Besides the final her tests were straightforward. The class isnt a walk in the park but its manageable and Professor Wen helped.
